Authors:
Stefan Daniel Löfstrand, Åsa Krüger, Sylvain G
Razafimandimbison, Birgitta Bremer
Title:
Phylogeny and generic delimitations in the sister tribes
Hymenodictyeae and Naucleeae (Rubiaceae)
Keywords: chloroplast DNA, Cinchonoideae, nuclear DNA, taxonomy
Abstract:
The Hymenodicteae-Naucleeae clade (Rubiaceae,
Cinchonoideae) is a predominantly Paleotropical group with 220 species
in 28 genera. The phylogenetic relationships and generic limits within
Naucleeae have previously been assessed using combined
molecular-morphological data, however the generic status of some genera
remains questionable. The evolutionary relationships within
Hymenodictyeae have never been investigated before. We performed
Bayesian analyses of the Hymenodictyeae-Naucleeae clade using combined
nuclear [nrETS; nrITS] data and chloroplast [ndhF; rbcL; rps16; trnT-F]
data and a large sampling from both tribes. Our study supports the
monophyly of the tribes, all subtribes of Naucleeae (Adininae,
Breoniinae, Cephalanthinae, Corynantheinae, Mitragyninae, Naucleinae,
and Uncariinae), and the Hymenodoctyeae genera Hymenodictyon and
Paracorynanthe. Five genera, Adina, Corynanthe, Fleroya, Nauclea, and
Neonauclea, are non-monophyletic, as Adinauclea, Burttdavya, Haldina,
Ludekia, Metadina, Mitragyna, Myrmeconauclea, Ochreinauclea,
Pausinystalia, Pertusadina, and Sarcocephalus are nested within the
former genera. We provisionally maintain the current generic status of
Breonia and its satellite genera, also Diyaminauclea, and Neonauclea and
its allied genera, pending further study. In summary, we recognize 17
genera: Adina s.l., Breonadia, Breonia, Cephalanthus, Corynanthe s.l.,
Diyaminauclea, Gyrostipula, Janotia, Khasiaclunea, Ludekia, Mitragyna
s.l., Myrmeconauclea, Nauclea s.l. Neolamarckia, Neonauclea,
Ochreinauclea, and Uncaria.
